page.title: 10Dean Castle _ Kilmarnock
page.content:
Open 12th May to 22nd September Weekdays 2-5pm. Sat/Sun 12 noon-5pm. Admission 50p. (Free to all residents of Kilmarnock and Loudoun District, to all children under 16 and all school parties.) Pre-book for organised parties. Special openings can be arranged outwith normal hours.
In 1316 Robert 1 granted by charter to Robert Boyd lands which had formerly belonged to the Loccards and the de Soules. Inhabited until 1735: destroyed by fire: restored 1905, 1933-37 by Lord Howard de Walden. Donated to the town of Kilmarnock by the de Walden family in 1975. Maintained and staffed by the Museum Department of the District Leisure Services from the local rates.
